holidays.name: New Year's Day
holidays.description: New Year’s Day is celebrated many countries such as in India on the January 1 in the Gregorian calendar.

holidays.name: Makar Sankranti
holidays.description: Makar Sankranti is a restricted holiday in India

holidays.name: Lohri
holidays.description: Lohri is a observance in India

holidays.name: Pongal
holidays.description: Many southern states in India, particularly Tamil Nadu, celebrate Pongal as a thanksgiving for the good harvest season in mid-January every year.

holidays.name: Lunar New Year
holidays.description: Lunar New year is an annual global celebration in many countries including India.

holidays.name: Republic Day
holidays.description: India's Republic Day marks the anniversary of the adoption of the Indian constitution. It is an annual gazetted holiday in India on January 26.

holidays.name: Vasant Panchami
holidays.description: Vasant Panchami, or India’s spring festival, is a Hindu event that includes special rituals and highlights the start of spring.

holidays.name: Guru Ravidas Jayanti
holidays.description: Guru Ravidas Jayanti is a restricted holiday in India

holidays.name: Hazarat Ali's Birthday
holidays.description: Hazarat Ali's Birthday is a restricted holiday in India

holidays.name: Valentine's Day
holidays.description: Valentine’s Day is celebrated in many places worldwide, including in India, on February 14 each year.

holidays.name: Maharishi Dayanand Saraswati Jayanti
holidays.description: Maharishi Dayanand Saraswati Jayanti is a restricted holiday in India

holidays.name: Maha Shivaratri/Shivaratri
holidays.description: Maha Shivratri is an annual festival dedicated to Shiva, the Hindu God of destruction. For devotees, is a day of reflection and meditation.

holidays.name: Shivaji Jayanti
holidays.description: Shivaji Jayanti is a restricted holiday in India

holidays.name: Dolyatra
holidays.description: Dolyatra is a restricted holiday in India

holidays.name: Holika Dahana
holidays.description: Holika Dahana is a restricted holiday in India

holidays.name: Holi
holidays.description: Holi is a spring festival of colors celebrated by Hindus, Sikhs and others. It celebrates the triumph of good over evil and the upcoming season of spring. The festival can last up to sixteen days.

holidays.name: March Equinox
holidays.description: March Equinox in India (New Delhi)

holidays.name: Chaitra Sukhladi
holidays.description: Chaitra Sukhladi is a restricted holiday in India

holidays.name: Ugadi
holidays.description: Ugadi is a restricted holiday in India

holidays.name: Gudi Padwa
holidays.description: Gudi Padwa is a restricted holiday in India

holidays.name: Rama Navami
holidays.description: Rama Navami is a Hindu festival that celebrates the birth of Rama, the first son of King Dasaratha of Ayodhya.

holidays.name: Mahavir Jayanti
holidays.description: Mahavir Jayanti is a gazetted holiday in India

holidays.name: First day of Passover
holidays.description: During Passover, the Jewish people remember the liberation of the Israelites from slavery, their exodus from Egypt, and that their first-born children were spared during the 10th plague, as told in the Haggadah.

holidays.name: Maundy Thursday
holidays.description: Maundy Thursday is a Christian observance on the Thursday during Holy Week. It is the day before Good Friday.

holidays.name: Good Friday
holidays.description: Many Christians commemorate Jesus Christ’s crucifixion and death on Good Friday. It is a gazetted holiday in India.

holidays.name: Easter Day
holidays.description: Easter Sunday commemorates Jesus Christ’s resurrection, according to Christian belief.

holidays.name: Vaisakhi
holidays.description: Vaisakhi, also known as Baisakhi, is a harvest celebration on either April 13 or April 14 in the Gregorian calendar. It is one of India’s most notable celebrations.

holidays.name: Ambedkar Jayanti
holidays.description: Ambedkar Jayanti is a observance in India

holidays.name: Mesadi / Vaisakhadi
holidays.description: Mesadi / Vaisakhadi is a restricted holiday in India

holidays.name: Jamat Ul-Vida
holidays.description: Jamat Ul-Vida is a restricted holiday in India

holidays.name: Ramzan Id/Eid-ul-Fitar
holidays.description: Eid al-Fitr is a holiday to mark the end of the Islamic month of Ramadan, during which Muslims fast during the hours of daylight.

holidays.name: Ramzan Id/Eid-ul-Fitar
holidays.description: One day of Eid-ul-Fitar, which marks the end of Ramadan, is a gazetted holiday in India.

holidays.name: Buddha Purnima/Vesak
holidays.description: Vesak, also known as Buddha Purnima, celebrates of Gautama Buddha's birth, enlightenment and death.

holidays.name: Birthday of Rabindranath
holidays.description: Birthday of Rabindranath is a restricted holiday in India

holidays.name: Mother's Day
holidays.description: Mother’s Day celebrates the achievements and efforts of mothers and mother figures.

holidays.name: Father's Day
holidays.description: Father’s Day celebrates fatherhood and male parenting on different dates worldwide.

holidays.name: Rath Yatra
holidays.description: Rath Yatra is a restricted holiday in India

holidays.name: June Solstice
holidays.description: June Solstice in India (New Delhi)

holidays.name: Bakrid/Eid ul-Adha
holidays.description: For India's more than 200 million Muslims, Bakrid, the Festival of Sacrifice, is one of the holiest days of the year.

holidays.name: Guru Purnima
holidays.description: Guru Purnima is a festival that honors spiritual Gurus by remembering their life and teachings. It is observed on the full moon day, Purnima, in the Hindu month of Ashadh, which is usually June or July.

holidays.name: Muharram/Ashura
holidays.description: Muharram, or the Islamic New Year, is a public holiday in India.

holidays.name: Friendship Day
holidays.description: Friendship Day is a observance in India

holidays.name: Independence Day
holidays.description: India's Independence Day is an annual gazetted holiday on August 15 to commemorate the day India became an independent nation.

holidays.name: Parsi New Year
holidays.description: Parsi New Year is a restricted holiday in India

holidays.name: Vinayaka Chathurthi
holidays.description: Ganesh Chaturthi is the great Ganesha festival that celebrates the birthday of Lord Ganesha during the Hindu Month of Bhadra, which usually falls between mid-August and mid-September. It is also known as Vinayaka Chaturthi and can last up to 10 days.

holidays.name: Onam
holidays.description: Onam is a restricted holiday in India

holidays.name: Raksha Bandhan (Rakhi)
holidays.description: Raksha Bandhan is a Hindu festival that is celebrated on the full moon of the Hindu month of Shravana (Shravan Poornima). The day is also sometimes referred to as Brother and Sister Day because it honors the relationship between brother and sister.

holidays.name: Janmashtami (Smarta)
holidays.description: Janmashtami (Smarta) is a restricted holiday in India

holidays.name: Janmashtami
holidays.description: Krishna Janmashtami is a Hindu festival that celebrates the birth of Krishna, the eighth incarnation of the god Vishnu. It is celebrated on the eighth day of the Hindu month of Bhadrava (Bhadrapada), which is usually in August or September.

holidays.name: Ganesh Chaturthi/Vinayaka Chaturthi
holidays.description: Ganesh Chaturthi is the great Ganesha festival that celebrates the birthday of Lord Ganesha during the Hindu Month of Bhadra, which usually falls between mid-August and mid-September. It is also known as Vinayaka Chaturthi and can last up to 10 days.

holidays.name: September Equinox
holidays.description: September Equinox in India (New Delhi)

holidays.name: Milad un-Nabi/Id-e-Milad
holidays.description: Milad un-Nabi is a gazetted holiday in India and marks the Prophet Muhammad's birthday.

holidays.name: Mahatma Gandhi Jayanti
holidays.description: Mahatma Gandhi's birthday is an annual gazetted holiday in India on October 2.

holidays.name: First Day of Sharad Navratri
holidays.description: First Day of Sharad Navratri is a observance and Hindu holiday in India

holidays.name: First Day of Durga Puja Festivities
holidays.description: First Day of Durga Puja Festivities is a observance and Hindu holiday in India

holidays.name: Maha Saptami
holidays.description: Maha Saptami is a restricted holiday in India

holidays.name: Maha Ashtami
holidays.description: Maha Ashtami is a restricted holiday in India

holidays.name: Maha Navami
holidays.description: Maha Navami is a restricted holiday in India

holidays.name: Dussehra
holidays.description: Dussehra, also known as Vijaya Dashami, is an Indian festival that celebrates good forces over evil forces. It spans for 10 days and is celebrated in varied traditions across India.

holidays.name: Maharishi Valmiki Jayanti
holidays.description: Maharishi Valmiki Jayanti is a restricted holiday in India

holidays.name: Halloween
holidays.description: Halloween is a festive occasion that is celebrated in many countries on October 31 each year.

holidays.name: Karaka Chaturthi (Karva Chauth)
holidays.description: Karwa Chauth is an annual one-day festival that honors the Hindu god Shiva and goddess Parvati. It is celebrated by all married Hindu women on the fourth day after the full moon in the Hindu month of Kartik, which is usually in October.

holidays.name: Naraka Chaturdasi
holidays.description: Naraka Chaturdasi is a restricted holiday in India

holidays.name: Diwali/Deepavali
holidays.description: Diwali is a festival of physical and spiritual light celebrated in October or November each year.

holidays.name: Govardhan Puja
holidays.description: Govardhan Puja is a restricted holiday in India

holidays.name: Bhai Duj
holidays.description: Bhai Duj is a Hindu festival that celebrates the relationship between a brother and a sister on the second day after the new moon in the Hindu month of Kartika.

holidays.name: Chhat Puja (Pratihar Sashthi/Surya Sashthi)
holidays.description: Chhat Puja (Pratihar Sashthi/Surya Sashthi) is a restricted holiday in India

holidays.name: Guru Tegh Bahadur's Martyrdom Day
holidays.description: Guru Tegh Bahadur's Martyrdom Day is a restricted holiday in India

holidays.name: Guru Nanak Jayanti
holidays.description: Guru Nanak Jayanti is a gazetted holiday in India

holidays.name: First Day of Hanukkah
holidays.description: Hanukkah, also known as Chanukah or the Festival of Lights, is celebrated for 8 days between the 25th day of the month of Kislev to the second day of Tevet in the Hebrew calendar.

holidays.name: Last day of Hanukkah
holidays.description: Hanukkah, also known as Chanukah or the Festival of Lights, is celebrated for eight days between the 25th day of the month of Kislev to the second day of Tevet in the Hebrew calendar.

holidays.name: December Solstice
holidays.description: December Solstice in India (New Delhi)

holidays.name: Christmas Eve
holidays.description: Christmas Eve is the day before Christmas Day and falls on December 24 in the Gregorian calendar.

holidays.name: Christmas
holidays.description: Many Christians celebrate Christmas Day, which is a gazetted holiday in India, on December 25 each year.

holidays.name: New Year's Eve
holidays.description: New Year’s Eve is the last day of the year, December 31, in the Gregorian calendar.
